statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
The Minnesota Timberwolves played one of
their most complete games of the season and gained some momentum
heading into the All-Star break.
article.headline: Nesterovic provides lift for Minnesota
article.linkText: Timberwolves get complete effort against Rockets
article.story:
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) -- The Minnesota Timberwolves played one of their most complete games of the season and gained some momentum heading into the All-Star break.
 
Garnett
Kevin Garnett scored 23 points and Rasho Nesterovic added 19 and played tough defense against Yao Ming as the Wolves held off the Houston Rockets 103-89 on Tuesday night. Garnett grabbed 11 boards and added nine assists for the Timberwolves, who lost by 20 at Houston on Friday. "K.G. was a monster again," Minnesota coach Flip Saunders said. After losing two straight to Houston, the Wolves earned a 2-2 split of the season series against their Midwest Division foes. Minnesota heads into the break with a nine-game home winning streak and a two-game winning streak overall. "I always think it's important to stay aggressive before the break," Garnett said. "I told the guys yesterday and today to stay focused. The All-Star break begins Wednesday, not Tuesday." While Garnett, who'll make his sixth All-Star appearance this weekend, narrowly missed his fourth triple-double of the season, Nesterovic held his own against the 7-foot-6 Yao and provided timely baskets for Minnesota. Nesterovic went 9-for-14 from the floor, including several hook shots over Yao which brought loud cheers from the crowd. "You just have to come aggressive against him," Nesterovic said. "The past two games at Houston, we just didn't get out aggressive. They caught us maybe a little bit tired from back-to-back (games). It's just part of the game we should play." Steve Francis led Houston with 31 points, but started losing his shooting touch down the stretch. The Houston point guard shot 2-for-7 in the fourth quarter and finished 11-of-21. "When I'm open, I'm going to take the shot," Francis said. "The shots I took tonight were open shots. There were still plenty of shots left for the other guys." Yao, who had his 14th double-double Friday against the Wolves, scored 12 points on a 4-for-7 performance. A free throw by James Posey pulled Houston to 77-75 with 10:20 to go in the game. But Minnesota went on a decisive 20-8 run which saw five different Wolves players score a basket. All five Minnesota starters scored in double figures. The Rockets stayed close through most of the second half and stopped Minnesota from making any big runs before the fourth quarter. The Wolves built a 77-69 lead with 11:29 left in the fourth. But Houston answered with six unanswered points. Saunders was livid, yelling at the officials, laughing at calls and muttering, "I have never seen anything like this in my life," after one call. The Wolves swarmed Yao early, often double-teaming him with Garnett and Nesterovic and forcing him outside the paint. "I'm not used to that," Yao said of being guarded by two big men. "We're both pretty long," Nesterovic said. "Not like he is. But at least we can batter him." Francis was able to keep the Rockets in the game, scoring 13 points on 5-of-8 shooting in the first half. The Wolves led by as many as nine points in the first half, pulling ahead 32-23 on Anthony Peeler's 17-footer in the second quarter. But Houston outscored the Wolves 22-13 to close out the half in a 45-all tie. Game notes
Houston is 6-4 against Minnesota in its last 10 meetings. ... Garnett drew a loud ovation after winning the opening tip against Yao. The crowd cheered loudly again when the 6-foot-7 Wally Szczerbiak went up against the Rockets' center, chanting ``WA-LLY! WA-LLY!'' But the tip went out of bounds to the Rockets. ... Peeler started his second straight game in the absence of F Joe Smith (ankle). Peeler started at guard and Szczerbiak again was shifted to forward. ... Houston C Kelvin Cato went through pregame warmups, but sat out his second straight game with a hip flexor strain.
